name: Event
description: The root of the Unified Data Model event structure.

children.name: metadata
children.description: Provides essential information about the event, such as the timestamp, event type, and product details.

children.name: principal
children.description: The primary acting noun in the event. It represents the entity that performed the action.

children.name: target
children.description: The noun that was acted upon in the event. This is the entity that was the target of the action.

children.name: src
children.description: The source noun of the event, often used in network-related activities to represent the origin of a connection.

children.name: observer
children.description: The noun that observed the event, such as a monitoring agent or network sensor.

children.name: intermediate
children.description: Represents any intermediary nouns in the event, such as proxies or relays.

children.name: about
children.description: The noun that the event is about, providing context when the other noun fields are not sufficient.

children.name: security_result
children.description: Contains details about security-related outcomes, such as classifications, severity, and threat information.

children.name: network
children.description: Holds data related to network activity, including protocols, traffic details, and session information.

children.name: extensions
children.description: A flexible field to store additional, non-standard information from the original log.
